section.title: Grammatical function tags
section.p: In May 2005 we introduced gramamtical function tags (@SUBJ, @OBJ, etc.), based upon a compromise between the Sámi gramamtical tradition and the conventions found in the visl project .

section.title: A systematic grouping of the tags
section.p: The Sámi disambiguation file sme-dis.rle adds syntactic tags th each cohort.

section.title: The verb tags
section.p: This set seems ok: We have finite and infine main and auxiliary verbs.

section.title: The major function tags
section.p: The four main functions for subject, object and their predicatives are obvious.
The @SUBJ-QH is a tag for quantifier heads of nouns. This goes both for singular and plural quantifiers.
The @-FSUBJ is a tag for subjects of infinite verbs, like mu in Diet dáhpáhuvai mu dieđikeahttá. The tag hits rarely, e.g. not once in our corpus of bureaucratic texts.

section.title: The adverbial tags
section.p: The @ADV-A tag is for adverbs modifying adjectives, and the @ADV-ADV tag is for adverbs modifying adverbs.
Discussion: We should consider unifying some of the adverbial tags. Against unification speak the possibilites of using the fine-grained distinctions in the disambiguation.

section.title: The NP-internal modifiers
section.p: The @NUM-PRON tag is for numerals modifying pronouns to their left, like in Mii golmmas finaimet máná geahčen.
The @NUMBER tag is for numerals that only represent numbering, not amount.

The @MEASURE tag is for measure words standing as complements of numerals, and acting as classifiers, like "miilla" and "jagi" in Ádjá viessu lea guokte miilla bajábeal márkana. Dat dáhpáhuvai golbma jagi maŋŋil.,
The @TIME tag is for numerals denoting time, like "2004" in Dat dáhpáhuvai jagi 2004, iige odne. In this example, only "2004" gets the @TIME tag, not "odne".
There are 10 tags for constituents modifying a noun from the left, selecting, adjective, Actio, Determiner, Genitive noun or pronoun, proper noun, participle, pronoun or quantifier.
Discussion: The quantifier modifying N is for the oblique cases like Son lea viđa jági boaris.
There are 5 tags for constituents modifying from the right, quantifiers (@QN<) and pronouns (@PronN<) modifying nouns, and nouns modifying pronouns (@NPRON<) and quantifiers (@NQ<).

section.title: An alphabetic list of tags
section.p: Here is a list of tags, with a definition or description and example following each of them

dl.dd: Subject of infinite verb, e.g. of Actio Gen.

dd.em: "<nu>" ("<Gulahallan Sámedikkiin dán gažaldagas šaddá nu konkrehtalažžan go vejolaš.>")
“<man>” (“<Man dávjá mun livččen dáhtton čohkket du mánáid.>”)

dl.dd: Actio Nominative. This tag is problematic! "<dahkan>" (“<Sii orro sin iežaset dahkan darfegođiid siste.>”)

dd.em: "<muhto>" (“Na muhto don it leat dasa nama čállán!”)

dl.dd: This is the syntactic parallel of the morphological Cmpnd tag, used to mark the first part of expressions like mánáid- ja nuoraidprykiatriija.

dd.em: "<oahppo->" ("<Oahppo- ja dutkanministtar dat lea ráhkadan dieđáhusa alit sámi oahpu ja dutkama birra.>")
"<go>" (“<Leago guhkes áigi dassá go Máreha oidnet?”>)
"<dáid>" ("<Politihkalaččat lea govdes ovttamielatvuohta dáid váldolinjáid hárrái Stuorradikkis.>")

dl.dd: Preadijectival genitive modifier. It is mapped after the @GN> tag and thus not in conflict with it.

dd.em: “<girjji>” (“<Duon guovtti girjji buoret dat gal lea.>”)
"<oahpu>", "<dutkama>" ("<Oahppo- ja dutkanministtar dat lea ráhkadan dieđáhusa alit sámi oahpu ja dutkama birra.>")
“<oasálaččaid>” (“<Finnmárkkus ii goassige leat leamaš ságastallan gaskal muhtun muddui seammadássásaš oasálaččaid.>”)

dl.dd: Noun modifying pronouns to the left.
Noun modifying quantifier noun to the left.

dd.em: “<golmmas>” (“<Mii golmmas oktan du vieljain finaimet Niillas-čeazi geahčen.>”)
"<I>" ("<Dieđáhusa oasis I ovdanbuktojuvvo Ovttasbargoráđđehusa sámepolitihkalaš vuođđolávdi.>")
"<vejolaš>" ("<Gulahallan Sámedikkiin dán gažaldagas šaddá nu konkrehtalažžan go vejolaš.>")

dl.dd: Syntactic tag for proper noun attributes, of the type "Tove" in "Tove Bull".
Present participle modifying noun to the right.
Pronoun modifying a noun to the right.
Pronoun modifying a noun to the left.

dd.em: “<ovtta>” (“<Galgá čájehit vuollegašvuođa juohke ovtta divššohasa eallimii.>”)

dl.dd: Quantifier modifying noun to the left.
Subject with a quantifier head. 10 jági lea vássán. Okta dain doaimmain lea redigeret ja čorget journála. "<máŋggat>" ("<Boazodoalus leat máŋggat hástalusat ovddabealde. >")
Numeral as apposition to the noun "year".

dd.em: “<1897>” (“<Sápmelaččat leat jagi 1897 lihkostuvvan cealkit riektái, ahte...>”)

dl.dd: A dummy tag assigned when no tag assignment rule has hit. This tag is useful for finding the flaws in the tag mapping section.
